profileText: a Representative from Pennsylvania; born in Watertown, Jefferson County, N.Y., August 30, 1959; graduated from Watertown High School, Watertown, N.Y., 1976; B.A., Colgate University, Hamilton, N.Y., 1980; J.D., University of Pennsylvania, Philadelphia, Pa., 1984; lawyer, private practice; judicial law clerk, superior court of Pennsylvania; member of the Wallingford-Swarthmore (Pa.) school board, 2007-2015, president, 2009-2011; National Pro Bono Counsel; elected simultaneously as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fifteenth and the One Hundred Sixteenth Congresses, by special election, to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of United States Representative Patrick Meehan, and reelected to the succeeding Congress (November 6, 2018-present).
